definition: to be unable to stand
to prohibit/to forbid
to endure
(negative prefix)/not/no

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Forever inability to wait, it can not withstand injuries.
sentences.chinese: 永远禁不起等待，也禁不起伤害。

sentences.english: Forever inability to wait, it can not withstand injuries.
sentences.chinese: 永远禁不起等待，也禁不起伤害。

sentences.english: Not even the most dedicated person is immune to the temptation of occasional chitchat.
sentences.chinese: 即使是最专注的人也禁不起偶尔聊天的诱惑。

sentences.english: Institute of Interpretation of love, found love the most can not stand the original injury.
sentences.chinese: 学会解读爱情，发现爱情原来最禁不起伤害。

sentences.english: Love is really just couldn't stand the test and temptations?
sentences.chinese: 爱情真的就这样禁不起考验和诱惑吗？

definition: can't stand it/to be unable to bear/to be unable to resist
to be unable to bear
to stand/to endure
to be able to withstand/to be able to endure
to be unable to bear or support
(coll.) unable to withstand/cannot bear/can't stand it/no match for
to be able to endure (exertion, fatigue etc)/to be able to afford
to bear/to enjoy (usually in negative combination, meaning unable to enjoy)
to toss from side to side (e.g. sleeplessly)/to repeat sth over and over again/to torment sb/to play crazy/to squander (time, money)
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
to be unavoidable (idiom)
unfortunately cannot enjoy (idiom)
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
unable to tolerate/intolerant/unable to bear sth
